title: Multimodal Pipelines for Stroke Detection
author: Radiant Group
excerpt: Designing stroke detection systems using complementary sensory modalities.
content:
## Context
Stroke symptoms manifest across multiple modalities, including speech, facial movement, and visual cues.

Ignoring any of these signals risks incomplete assessment.

## Problem Statement
Unimodal systems miss critical cues and produce brittle predictions.

## Design Principles
- Modular signal processing
- Representation-level fusion

## System Overview
Audio and vision pipelines are processed independently before fusion.

## Evaluation
Each modality is evaluated separately to understand its contribution.

## Limitations
Temporal synchronization remains complex and error-prone.

## Conclusion
Stroke detection systems must reflect the multimodal nature of clinical symptoms.
